channel.title: [Java] Object Orientation Review [Java]
channel.description:
[i][b]Object Orientation[/b][/i] [hr] Java is inherently [i]object-oriented[/i], which means that Java programs are made up of programming elements called [i]objects[/i]. Simply put (don't you just love the word, simply?), an object is a programming entity that represents either some real-world object or an abstract concept.
All objects have two basic characteristics;
[ul][li]Objects have data, also known as [i]state[/i]. For example, an object that represents a book has data such as the book's title, author, and publisher.[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]Objects also have [i]behaviour[/i], which means that they can perform certain tasks. In Java, these taks are called [i]methods[/i]. For example, an object that represents a car might have methods such as start, stop, drive, or crash. Some methods simply allow you to access the object's data. For example, a book object might have a [b]getTitle[/b] method that tells you the books title.[/li][/ul]
[i]Classes[/i] are closely related to objects. A class is the program code you write to create objects. The class describes the data and method that define the the object's state and behaviour. Then, when the program exectues, classes are used to create objects.
For example, suppose your writing a payroll program. This program probably needs objects to represents the company's employees. So, the program includes a class (probably named [i]Employee[/i]) that defines the data and methods for each [i]employee[/i] object. Then, when your program runs, it uses this class to create an object for each of your company's employees.
Thats all for today! Thanks for reading and I hope this was a good recap. ;) Project.

item.description:

[quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=304695.msg2444294#msg2444294 date=1221620054]

^ Wtf? You posted the same thing on Moparscape.
[/quote]Copypasta

Were’nt you a Global Moderator?
[/quote]Notice the “Ex-Staff.”

Guys, it was funny the first few posts or so (not really, but you get what I’m trying to say). Now it’s just stupid and old. It’s a forum, and those who are new are, simply put, unaccustomed to the way we work things here. So either help him out (properly w/o any bull), or gtfo before this community dies. We wouldn’t want moparisthebest to go empty-handed on the weekends, would we?

Thanks alot TeleNubby.
By the way, il remove the nonsense I posted before.

I am so pleased that everyone quoted him. In 20 or 30 years someone will go through the archives and LOL at PE’s stupidity.[/quote]assuming he doesnt darwinise himself

Read full topic
